item.title: ‘Absolute joke’: Passenger annoyed as Delta Airlines gives his first-class seat to service dog - The Times of India
item.description:
‘Absolute joke’: Passenger annoyed as Delta Airlines gives his first-class seat to service dog

Date: [Date of Publication] Source: [Source of Publication]

A Delta Airlines passenger expressed frustration after the airline assigned his first-class seat to a service dog, leading to significant dissatisfaction with the airline's handling of seat assignments.

  • The passenger claims to have booked and paid for a first-class ticket.
  • Delta Airlines prioritized accommodating the service dog over the passenger.
  • This incident has sparked discussions regarding airline policies on service dogs and passenger rights.
“It's an absolute joke that someone who pays for first class can be treated this way.”

This situation raises questions about airline policies concerning service animals and how they are implemented in practice.

item.title: Rohan Mirchandani Epigamia co-founder passes away - Heart attack claims another shining star of corporate world - ET Now
item.description:
Epigamia Co-Founder Rohan Mirchandani Passes Away at 42

Updated: December 22, 2024 | Source: Economic Times

Rohan Mirchandani, co-founder of Drums Food International and the yogurt brand Epigamia, died from a cardiac arrest on December 21, 2024, at the age of 42, shocking the corporate and startup worlds.

  • Mirchandani was an MBA graduate from The Wharton School.
  • He held a Bachelor’s degree in Finance & International Business from NYU Stern.
  • Epigamia was founded in 2007 and produces various dairy products.
“All of us at the Epigamia family will deeply mourn this loss. Rohan was our mentor, friend, and leader...” - Ankur Goel and Uday Thakker

This unexpected loss mirrors a troubling trend in the Indian startup ecosystem, where several notable leaders have passed away recently. The company is now managed by its senior leadership team in the wake of this tragedy.

item.title: Red carpet for foreign arrivals, make 'India inevitable': Hospitality sector's New Year resolution | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Red carpet for foreign arrivals, make ’India inevitable’: Hospitality sector’s New Year resolution

Date: December 22, 2023 | Source: PTI

The Indian hospitality industry is poised for a significant rebound as it aims to surpass pre-Covid international tourist arrivals and contribute $1 trillion to the economy by 2047. Industry leaders are calling for governmental support to facilitate this growth.

  • The hospitality sector expects to welcome over 30 million foreign tourists by 2028.
  • Projected growth of domestic tourism by 15-20% driven by initiatives like 'Dekho Apna Desh'.
  • Hotel occupancy rates are predicted to rise to 75% or higher.
  • Industry leaders are advocating for hotels to be classified as infrastructure for better support and financing.
  • The total contribution of the sector to India's GDP could grow by 10-12%.
“The hospitality sector's multiplier effect on the economy surpasses that of manufacturing and agriculture.” - KB Kachru, HAI President

In conclusion, the Indian hospitality sector is on an optimistic trajectory towards recovery and growth, reliant on supportive policies and infrastructure investment from the government.

item.title: Epigamia co-founder Rohan Mirchandani passes away at 41 due to cardiac arrest - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Epigamia Co-Founder Rohan Mirchandani Passes Away at 41 Due to Cardiac Arrest

Published: 22 December 2024, 10:03 IST

Rohan Mirchandani, co-founder of Epigamia, tragically passed away on December 21 due to a cardiac arrest. His loss has deeply affected the company and its employees.

"It is with deep sorrow that Drums Food International confirms the untimely passing of its beloved founder, Rohan Mirchandani, who suffered a sudden cardiac arrest yesterday," stated the company.
  • Rohan Mirchandani was 41 years old at the time of his passing.
  • He founded Drums Food International in 2013, which is the parent company of Epigamia, a leading Greek yogurt brand in India.
  • Dr. Ankur Goel and Uday Thakker have expressed their commitment to continue Mirchandani's vision.
"All of us at the Epigamia family will deeply mourn this loss. Rohan was our mentor, friend, and leader," said Goel and Thakker in their tribute.

The company has requested respect for Mirchandani's family's privacy during this difficult time.

item.title: Rs 1 crore ‘just not enough’ to start any business in today’s world. Kumar Mangalam Birla explains why - The Economic Times
item.description:
Kumar Mangalam Birla: Rs. 1 Crore Isn't Enough to Start a Business Today

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Not specified

In a recent podcast interview, Kumar Mangalam Birla, Chairman of the Aditya Birla Group, stated that an investment of Rs. 1 crore is insufficient to start any business in today's competitive environment.

  • Birla emphasized the importance of leadership, discipline, and trust within management.
  • He shared personal anecdotes about managing 180,000 people and the significance of maintaining calm in corporate settings.
  • Birla highlighted the shift in business dynamics, asserting that management evolves from science to art as companies grow.
  • He acknowledged that capital requirements for startups have changed and stressed the value of leveraging existing networks for business growth.
  • Birla offered advice to new entrepreneurs, emphasizing the need for passion and a strong team.
“If you want to grow, the only way to grow is to have energized teams.” – Kumar Mangalam Birla

Birla believes in the necessity of corporate responsibility and philanthropy without publicizing charitable works.

item.title: Pink soaps, handwashes...: Anand Mahindra says, 'Delighted to see that ...' - The Times of India
item.description:
Anand Mahindra Expresses Delight Over New Soap Products

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here]

Source: [Insert Source Here]

Anand Mahindra shares his thoughts on the latest handwash and soap products that have been introduced, expressing his pleasure at seeing these innovations in the market.

  • Mahindra reflects on the importance of hygiene products during these times.
  • The products include a variety of pink soaps and handwashes.
  • He advocates for more brands to focus on hygiene and cleanliness.
"Delighted to see that..."

This sentiment highlights the growing focus on hygiene in society today.

item.title: Top billionaires who added the most billions to their wealth in 2024: No 1 is no surprise - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Top billionaires who added the most billions to their wealth in 2024: No 1 is no surprise

Date: December 12, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

As of December 12, 2024, Mark Zuckerberg's net worth increased by $94.8 billion, fueled by Meta's advancements in the metaverse and artificial intelligence technologies. Other billionaires also saw significant increases in their wealth due to various factors related to their industry performances.

  • 1. Elon Musk - Net Worth: $442.3 billion (+$213.2 billion)
  • 2. Jeff Bezos - Net Worth: $247.9 billion (+$71 billion)
  • 3. Mark Zuckerberg - Net Worth: $222.9 billion (+$94.8 billion)
  • 4. Larry Ellison - Net Worth: $195.4 billion (+$72.5 billion)
  • 5. Larry Page - Net Worth: $171.1 billion (+$44.7 billion)
  • 6. Jim Walton - Net Worth: $116.5 billion (+$43.9 billion)
  • 7. Alice Walton - Net Worth: $113.3 billion (+$43.2 billion)
  • 8. Rob Walton - Net Worth: $114 billion (+$42.8 billion)
  • 9. Sergey Brin - Net Worth: $161 billion (+$41 billion)
  • 10. Michael Dell - Net Worth: $114.6 billion (+$36.1 billion)
  • 11. Changpeng Zhao - Net Worth: $63.2 billion (+$28.9 billion)
"Elon Musk continues to lead the world's billionaires with a staggering net worth of $442.3 billion."

This year saw many billionaires, including major figures like Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos, benefiting largely from advancements in technology and industry growth, solidifying their positions atop global wealth rankings.

item.title: New Honda Activa 125 launched at Rs 94,422 - BikeWale
item.description:
New Honda Activa 125 launched at Rs 94,422

Publication Date: Updated
Source: BikeWale

Honda has introduced an updated Activa 125 which features minor styling changes and significant upgrades in technology. The scooter will be available for sale soon in two variants.

  • The Activa 125 will be sold in two variants: DLX priced at Rs 94,422 and H-Smart priced at Rs 97,146.
  • It features a new 4.2-inch TFT display with Bluetooth compatibility.
  • The engine is OBD 2B compliant and retains the same power output as the outgoing model.
  • An idling stop system is included to improve fuel efficiency.
  • The scooter comes in six colors and is available across all showrooms in India.
  • It competes with the TVS Jupiter 125 and the Suzuki Access 125.

item.title: Amazon's ex-employee's ‘appreciation post’ for Indian employees: Why ‘culture’ will always ‘eat strategy - The Times of India
item.description:
Amazon's ex-employee's ‘appreciation post’ for Indian employees: Why ‘culture’ will always ‘eat strategy for breakfast'

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

This article discusses a former Amazon employee's post appreciating Indian workers, arguing that company culture is paramount to success and often overshadows strategic objectives.

  • The ex-employee emphasizes the value of cultural integration within multinational companies.
  • Points out the diverse talents and resilience of Indian employees.
  • Comments on the challenges of merging corporate strategies with local cultural practices.
"Culture will always eat strategy for breakfast," said the former employee, highlighting the crucial role of workplace culture.

The message serves as a reminder for corporations to prioritize cultural understanding alongside strategic goals to achieve long-term success.

item.title: FPIs turn net sellers after two weeks of buying, withdraw Rs 976 crore amid global uncertainty - The Financial Express
item.description:
FPIs Turn Net Sellers After Two Weeks of Buying, Withdraw Rs 976 Crore Amid Global Uncertainty

Publication Date: December 20, 2023

Source: Financial Express

The Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) have shifted to net selling in the equity market after a consistent buying trend over two weeks, withdrawing Rs 976 crore due to global market uncertainties.

  • FPIs started the week positively, investing Rs 3,126 crore in Indian equities.
  • A reversal occurred with FPIs offloading Rs 4,102 crore in equities later, resulting in a net outflow.
  • Market sentiment was impacted by a strengthening US dollar and rising US 10-year bond yields.
  • Despite short-term withdrawals, FPIs infused Rs 21,789 crore into Indian equities in December, indicating long-term confidence.
  • Experts recommend investors to look into attractive valuations in large-cap stocks amid the sell-off.
  • Global factors, including US Fed meeting outcomes and rising inflation, contributed to the cautious approach of FPIs.
  • FPI flows have shown volatility throughout the year, reflecting fluctuating investment sentiment.
“The sudden change in FII strategy from buying to selling has impacted markets.” - V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services

The article underscores a significant shift in FPI investment strategies, hinting at underlying economic trends and risks that could shape future investment dynamics in India.

item.title: Buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends three stocks to buy on Monday — 23 December 2024 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Sumeet Bagadia recommends three stocks to buy on Monday — 23 December 2024

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Live Mint

Following a significant downturn in the Indian stock market after a hawkish outlook from the US Federal Reserve, Sumeet Bagadia, Executive Director at Choice Broking, advises caution for investors. He recommends buying three stocks: Titan Company, Petronet LNG, and Dr Reddy's Laboratories.

Key Points:

  • Nifty 50 Index: Dropped from 23,768 to 23,587.
  • BSE Sensex: Fell from 82,133 to 78,041.
  • Nifty Bank: Decreased from 53,583 to 50,759.
  • Sumeet Bagadia's Picks: Buy Titan Company at ₹3356.25, Petronet LNG at ₹336.45, and Dr Reddy's Laboratories at ₹1343.65.

Notable Quotes:

“The overall Indian stock market bias has weakened as the Nifty 50 index has slipped below 200-DEMA support.”

Conclusion:

Investors are advised to be cautious in the current market environment, with significant focus on the recommended stocks and their respective stop-loss levels.

item.title: Buy or sell: Ganesh Dongre of Anand Rathi picks three stocks to buy on Monday - 23 December | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Buy or sell: Ganesh Dongre of Anand Rathi picks three stocks to buy on Monday - 23 December

Publication Date: 23 December

Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market showed significant volatility this week due to the US Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts, leading to a correction across major indices. This article highlights the performance of the Nifty 50 and Bank Nifty indices, along with stock recommendations for investors.

Key Points:

  • The Nifty 50 index faced a correction of 3-5%, trading within a range of 23,500 – 25,000.
  • Bank Nifty suffered a 5% decline, closing at 50,700.
  • Support for Nifty is at 23,300, with resistance at 24,500 for the upcoming week.
  • Three stock recommendations for buying this week include Amber Enterprises India, RCF, and Godrej Industries.

Notable Quotes:

“Investors are advised to closely monitor key support and resistance levels as they evaluate trading opportunities.”

Conclusion:

Overall, both indices have closed below their respective support zones, indicating a bearish trend. Investors should approach trading with caution while observing critical market levels.

item.title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos to marry Lauren Sanchez in $600m ceremony at Kevin Costner's ranch: report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez to Marry in Lavish $600 Million Ceremony

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Jeff Bezos and his fiancée, Lauren Sanchez, are set to celebrate their wedding in Aspen, Colorado, with a budget of approximately $600 million for the event scheduled on December 28. The couple has opted for a winter-themed celebration at the luxury restaurant Matsuhisa.

  • The wedding venue has been reserved exclusively for elite guests from December 26 to 27.
  • About 180 guests are expected to attend the star-studded event, following the couple's engagement festivities in Italy.
  • Details about the wedding remain tightly under wraps, with NDAs for vendors involved.
  • Five-star hotels and private mansions have been booked for guests in Aspen.
“The wedding and accompanying celebrations will cost the couple a staggering $600 million.”

This lavish event marks a significant chapter in the lives of Bezos and Sanchez, highlighting their high-profile relationship and commitment.

item.title: Pegasus spyware case verdict in U.S.: Will Supreme Court conduct further inquiry, asks Surjewala - The Hindu
item.description:
Pegasus spyware case verdict in U.S.: Will Supreme Court conduct further inquiry, asks Surjewala

Date: December 22, 2024

Source: The Hindu

Congress general secretary Randeep Surjewala has urged the Supreme Court to investigate the implications of the recent Pegasus spyware case verdict in the U.S., which established that the NSO Group was liable for hacking.

  • The U.S. court found NSO Group liable for hacking, impacting 300 WhatsApp numbers belonging to Indians.
  • Surjewala called for the Supreme Court to inquire into those targeted and the methods used by the government.
  • He emphasized the need for accountability from the Narendra Modi government regarding the implications of the spyware.
  • WhatsApp’s head described the U.S. ruling as a victory for privacy rights.
  • The ongoing legal battle highlights concerns about surveillance practices and user privacy.
“The #PegasusSpyware case verdict proves how 300 WhatsApp numbers of Indians were targeted in the illegal spyware racket.” — Randeep Singh Surjewala

This ruling has sparked debate about the responsibility of tech companies and government accountability regarding surveillance technologies.

item.title: Proves how 300 WhatsApp numbers of Indians were targeted: Randeep Surjewala after U.S. court verdict on Pegasus - The Hindu
item.description:
Randeep Surjewala Highlights Targeting of 300 Indian WhatsApp Users After U.S. Court Verdict on Pegasus

Published on: December 22, 2024 10:47 am IST | Source: The Hindu

A recent U.S. court ruling holding Israel's NSO Group accountable for its spyware, Pegasus, has sparked criticism from Congress leader Randeep Surjewala, who pointed out that the verdict reinforces allegations that 300 WhatsApp numbers in India were targeted.

  • The U.S. judge ruled in favor of Meta Platforms’ WhatsApp in a lawsuit against NSO Group.
  • Surjewala emphasized the importance of revealing the identities of the targeted individuals.
  • WhatsApp had previously sued NSO for accessing its servers to install spyware.
  • The case will now proceed to trial on the issue of damages.
  • Will Cathcart, Head of WhatsApp, called the ruling a victory for privacy.
“The #PegasusSpyware case verdict proves how 300 WhatsApp numbers of Indians were targeted in the illegal spyware racket.” — Randeep Singh Surjewala

In conclusion, the court ruling raises important questions regarding privacy and accountability, highlighting the need for transparency about the individuals affected by the Pegasus spyware.

item.title: "Proves how 300 WhatsApp numbers of Indians were targeted": Randeep Surjewala after U.S. court verdict on Pegasus - The Hindu
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Viral Video: Passengers On Surat-Bangkok Flight Empty Liquor & Snacks Stock, You Won’t Believe How Much They Drank! - News24
item.description:
Viral Video: Passengers On Surat-Bangkok Flight Empty Liquor & Snacks Stock, You Won’t Believe How Much They Drank!

Date: December 22, 2024   Source: News24

In a rather bizarre incident, passengers on the Surat to Bangkok flight reportedly consumed the whole alcohol stock during the four-hour-long journey. There were a total of 300 passengers on the flight who finished about 15 litres of liquor worth Rs 1.8 lakh as well as some popular Gujarati snacks.

WATCH THE VIDEO HERE:

Surat to Bangkok flights started today.
Passengers drank 15 liters of alcohol on the flight, and the alcohol ran out even before the plane reached Bangkok.
300 passengers consumed alcohol worth ₹1.8 lakhs during the 4-hour-long journey. They even finished all the snacks. 🤣😂 pic.twitter.com/aq89qFS1xk

No official statement has been released so far regarding the incident. However, it has brought attention to alcohol consumption in Gujarat, which remains prohibited. The event has sparked debate on social media, with opinions divided between humor and concern.

  • 300 passengers consumed 15 litres of liquor.
  • The total cost of the alcohol was ₹1.8 lakhs.
  • Came to light through a viral video.
  • Highlight of alcohol consumption regulations in Gujarat.

item.title: 2025 Honda Activa 125 launched — Here’s what’s new - The Financial Express
item.description:
2025 Honda Activa 125 Launched — Here’s What’s New

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Financial Express

Honda has launched the updated Activa 125 in India, featuring enhanced aesthetics and functionality.

  • The updated Activa 125 is priced at Rs 94,422 (DLX variant) and Rs 97,146 (H-Smart variant).
  • New color options include Pearl Igneous Black, Matt Axis Gray Metallic, Pearl Deep Ground Gray, Pearl Siren Blue, Rebel Red Metallic, and Pearl Precious White.
  • The new instrument console includes a 4.2-inch TFT display with Bluetooth connectivity for navigation and alerts.
  • The Activa retains its 123.9cc engine, producing 8.3bhp and 10.5Nm of torque, with CVT gearbox and idling start-stop feature.
“The updated Honda Activa 125 gets added features and new color options.”

The 2025 Honda Activa 125 offers a blend of classic design and modern features, catering to the evolving needs of customers.

item.title: Outlook 2025: Top fund managers remain bullish on Indian stock market, suggest these 4 sectors to invest in | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Outlook 2025: Fund Managers Optimistic About Indian Stock Market Investments

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Market veterans and fund managers believe the Indian stock market is positioned for growth despite global challenges. They anticipate a revival in consumption and investment as key drivers for the market next year.

  • Fund managers are optimistic about the market, viewing current economic slowdowns as temporary.
  • They expect growth to recover with increased government and corporate spending in the second half of the year.
  • Key sectors for investment include IT, banks, FMCG, and infrastructure.
  • The shift in global supply chains presents opportunities for India to play a significant role.
  • Emerging industries like battery storage and green hydrogen are highlighted as future growth drivers.
"With a growing middle class and a favourable business environment, India can emerge as a key global economic player..." - Karan Doshi, Fund Manager.

The consensus among experts is that 2025 will provide robust opportunities for investors in various sectors as structural growth factors continue to support the Indian economy.

item.title: Real estate in Hyderabad may witness 47 pc dip in housing sales - The Siasat Daily
item.description:
Hyderabad's Housing Sales Projected to Drop by 47% in Q4 2024

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Siasat Daily

The real estate market in Hyderabad is expected to see a significant decline in housing sales, with projections estimating a 47% decrease during the October to December 2024 quarter.

  • Housing sales in Hyderabad are projected to fall to 12,682 units from 24,044 units in the same quarter of the previous year.
  • The decline is attributed to a high base effect, as stated by Samir Jasuja, CEO of PropEquity.
  • Overall sales across nine major cities in India are expected to drop to 1,08,261 units, down from 1,37,225 units year-over-year.
  • Despite the sales decline, Hyderabad has experienced a CAGR of 10% in residential launches over the past decade.
  • The city is recognized as the fastest-growing real estate market in India, driven by rapid infrastructure development.
“Hyderabad has shown remarkable progress in real estate, with a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 10 percent in residential launches over the past decade.”

The real estate sector in Hyderabad remains poised for future growth, supported by continuous investments in urban infrastructure.

item.title: Ex Amazon executive trolled for praising Bengaluru colleagues for 3 am meetings: ‘As if 60 hours was normal' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ex Amazon executive's post on Indian work culture went viral, sparking debates and getting trolled online for highlighting long work hours as dedication.

Publication Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A recent LinkedIn post by former Amazon executive Adam Broda has ignited a debate on work culture in India, shedding light on the demanding schedules of employees in global organizations. The post attracted hundreds of likes and sparked discussions across platforms.

Key Points:

  • Broda reflected on his experience at Amazon, highlighting that Indian colleagues worked longer than the 60-hour weeks he managed.
  • He noted significant enthusiasm among these colleagues, with some working even at odd hours like 3 am.
  • The post gained over 500 likes and was shared on Reddit, generating sharp reactions.
  • Comments reflected mixed feelings about dedication versus exploitation in the Indian work culture.

Notable Quotes:

“This is a testament to the dedication of Indian employees, but at what cost to their health and personal life?”
“In India, working long hours is seen as a badge of honour.”

In conclusion, Broda's commentary on the Indian work culture has sparked significant discourse on the implications of long working hours, raising questions about employee well-being in demanding job environments.
